title: Will Bayley's Strictly return dance confirmed after nasty knee injury
text:
Will is set to return to the dancefloor (Picture: BBC)

Will Bayley has been confirmed to still be in the running to return to this week’s Strictly Come Dancing after a nasty knee injury forced him out of last week’s competition.

Given a bye for one week after jumping off a table in rehearsals and collapsing in on his knee, the Paralympian has remained quiet about whether he’ll be forced to quit or not.

Posting only a few cryptic messages in the hope that he’ll be able to return, it looks like the star has got his wish and has not yet currently been forced to leave the competition.

Strictly have announced this week’s dance routines and Will is still in the line-up – and will join Janette Manrara in dancing a waltz to Weekend In New England by Barry Manilow.

However, no further updates about the star’s condition has been noted, so there is still a chance he might not be able to perform on Saturday’s live show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

He’ll be going up against Alex Scott and (hopefully) returning partner Neil Jones, who also had to be replaced last minute last week, who will be performing and American Smooth to Marvin Gaye’s Ain’t No Mountain High Enough.

Mike and Katya have been in the dance-off for the past two weeks in a row, and will now have a bigger fight than ever to keep their place after loved stars Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe leave last Sunday sparked a massive backlash.

They will Charleston to Those Magnificent Men In Their Flying Machines in a bid to keep their spot.

On a lighter note, Chris Ramsey and Karen Hauer will be representing the comedian’s Geordie roots (kind of) and doing a streetdance routine to Let’s Get Ready To Rhumble by PJ and Duncan – Ant and Dec’s 90s alter-egos.

Strictly Week 6 Dances revealed Alex and Neil: American Smooth to Ain’t No Mountain High Enough by Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell Emma and Anton: Rumba to Woman In Love by Barbra Streisand Michelle and Giovanni: Paso Doble to Another One Bites The Dust by Queen Saffron and AJ: Salsa to Instruction by Jax Jones feat. Demi Lovato and Stefflon Don Chris and Karen: Couples’ Choice (Street/Commercial) by Let’s Get Ready To Rhumble by PJ and Duncan Karim and Amy: Quickstep to Mr. Pinstripe Suit by Big Bad Voodoo Daddy Kelvin and Oti: Viennese Waltz to Say Something by A Great Big World and Christina Aguilera Mike and Katya: Charleston to Those Magnificent Men In Their Flying Machines by Ron Goodwin Orchestra Will and Janette: Waltz to Weekend In New England by Barry Manilow

More: Strictly Come Dancing Motsi Mabuse ‘never sees’ sister Oti since she joined her on Strictly Come Dancing Motsi Mabuse explains ‘livid’ reaction to Catherine Tyldesley’s Strictly exit: ‘I was sad' Strictly's Shirley Ballas stands by controversial Catherine and Johannes elimination

Advertisement

Advertisement

With just nine couples remaining on the show, the stakes are getting higher in order to fight for their place.

On Sunday, the Strictly pros will be paying tribute to Elton John with their group performance, and Emeli Sande will perform her new single Shine.

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday at 7.15pm on BBC One.

description: Paralympian Will Bayley badly hurt his knee during dance rehearsals last week, prompting fears he's have to leave the show.
